definition: concerted action/to collude (in dishonesty)
surname Lian
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Lian Shou all have not pulled to him.
Simon Peter motioned to this disciple and said, "Ask him which one he means."
sentences.chinese: 西門彼得說，主阿，不但我的腳，連手和頭也要洗。

sentences.english: He was too weak even to lift his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他虛弱得連手都擡不起來。

sentences.english: I was like frozen there and I didn't even know where to put my hands.
sentences.chinese: 我就像凍在那一樣，甚至連手都不知該放哪兒。

sentences.english: Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, not my feet only, but also [my] hands and [my] head.
sentences.chinese: 西門彼得說，主阿，不但我的腳，連手和頭也要洗。

sentences.english: At the next stage, they wanted to link up with their old partners.
sentences.chinese: 下一階段，他們想要和舊的夥伴連手。

sentences.english: They trussed up the captives hand and foot and dumped them in the back of the lorry.
sentences.chinese: 他們把俘虜們連手帶腳捆了起來，丟在卡車的後面。

sentences.english: Even handball teams used new software to spy on rivals' tactics.
sentences.chinese: 就連手球隊也採用新軟件來刺探對手的戰術。

sentences.english: See, I don't even have to move my arm to see the time.
sentences.chinese: 你瞧，我要看時間，就連手都不用轉。

sentences.english: Between us，even a touch of the hand would not occur.
sentences.chinese: 我們之間，連手也不要拉一下。

sentences.english: Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head.
sentences.chinese: 西門彼得說，主阿，不但我的腳，連手和頭也要洗。

definition: vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
stupefied/flabbergasted
to allow in fresh air/to allow a prisoner out for exercise/to give out information
to shrink back/to flinch
two-China (policy)
(Cantonese) iron pipe (weapon)
China Mobile Tietong, state-owned telecommunications operator (abbr. for 中移鐵通|中移铁通[Zhong1 yi2 Tie3 tong1])
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
smell of gunpowder/(fig.) combative tone/belligerence
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to abuse roundly
to fight alone (idiom)
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
